summary: This incident report details the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, including allegations of sexual misconduct involving minors. It outlines various interviews with victims and witnesses, surveillance activities, and the execution of search warrants at Epstein's residence. The report culminates in the Grand Jury's decision to indict Epstein for felony solicitation of prostitution.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the primary subject of the investigation, accused of soliciting minors for sexual acts.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell is mentioned as an associate of Epstein who facilitated introductions to young women for massages.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Alfredo Rodriguez is identified as Epstein's former houseman who provided insights into the operations at Epstein's residence.

persons.name: Janusz Banasiak
persons.context: Janusz Banasiak is mentioned as the house manager for Epstein, providing details about the massages and the young women involved.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.context: Leslie Wexner is mentioned as an associate of Epstein, with connections to his business dealings.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Alan Dershowitz is mentioned as Epstein's attorney, involved in discussions regarding the case.

persons.name: Paul A. Lavery
persons.context: Paul A. Lavery is identified as a private investigator who had contact with individuals involved in the case.

persons.name: Various Victims
persons.context: Multiple unnamed victims are referenced throughout the report, detailing their experiences with Epstein.

connections.description: Maxwell facilitated introductions to young women for Epstein.
Rodriguez was employed as Epstein's houseman and provided insights into the operations at Epstein's residence.
Banasiak served as the house manager for Epstein, overseeing staff and operations.
Dershowitz is Epstein's legal counsel, involved in discussions regarding the case.
The victims allege that Epstein solicited them for sexual acts.

events.title: Initial Allegation
events.description: The first report of sexual misconduct involving a minor at Epstein's residence.

events.title: Grand Jury Indictment
events.description: The Grand Jury returned a true bill for felony solicitation of prostitution against Epstein.

events.title: Search Warrant Execution
events.description: Police executed a search warrant at Epstein's residence, collecting evidence.

locations: 358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, FL
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was accused of soliciting minors for sexual acts.
Multiple victims reported being paid for massages that escalated to sexual acts.
The Grand Jury indicted Epstein for felony solicitation of prostitution on July 19, 2006.
Surveillance and search warrants were executed at Epstein's residence, revealing evidence of sexual misconduct.
Witnesses reported that Epstein often had young girls come to his house for massages.
